function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"The presence of foxes in urban areas has increased the likelihood of the small fox tapeworm e. multilocularis occurring in city rodents and infection risk for domestic dogs and cats.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vector-borne diseases spread by ectoparasitic organisms on rats , lyme disease, typhus, plague","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased asthma morbidity in inner-city children due to rat allergen sensitization and exposure","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential contamination of urban bodies of water with infectious disease agents from rats , campylobacter, salmonella, e. coli","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of zoonotic pathogens from urban rats to humans","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overpopulation of urban rats","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tick-borne disease prevalence in white-footed mice","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased connectivity of urban green areas may lead to higher tick populations, increasing the risk of tick-borne infections in humans.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of chemical sprays and applications for tick control threatens harmless non-target species and provides only temporary results.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent effectiveness of tick control methods in different ecological contexts, as demonstrated by the differing results of pyrethrin-soaked cotton fibers in different geographic locations.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased risk of zoonotic tick-borne infections due to climate change-induced increase in tick population and expansion of their habitats.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conflicting impact of deer density on tick-borne infections, with some studies suggesting a reduction and others indicating an increase in infections.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependency of other tick-borne diseases on the presence of deer, leading to increased risk of transmission and spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased presence of ticks in urban green spaces","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Zoonotic tick-borne pathogens in urban areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Critique of the biodiversity-buffers-disease paradigm","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-linear relationship between biodiversity and dilution effect","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Adding non-competent and competent host species in city environments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in biodiversity may lead to proliferation of pest and harmful organisms in urban environments.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disease-protective effects of biodiversity may not effectively reduce the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased prevalence of human schistosomiasis from dam constructions","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Arsenic exposure in bangladesh from construction of tube wells","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in human wastewater","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enteric involvement in hospitalised patients with covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unavailability of the exact number of covid-19 positive patients","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Immunosuppression in asymptomatic liver transplant recipients","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential enteric transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential community spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 in tourism destinations due to reduced risk perception and information mismanagement","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative influence on country and destination image due to misinformation and racial references related to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of detail-oriented behavior and increased spontaneous trait inferences leading to risk of epidemic spread","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological distance and construal level theory influencing perceived risk in tourism contexts may lead to inaccurate risk perceptions.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Individuals’ varying construal of psychological distance and covid-19-related risk perceptions may lead to inconsistent travel willingness and preferences.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dissemination of negative messages through social media may exacerbate country image problems and increase anxiety among tourists.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in small accommodation units due to shortened social distance with tourists","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Person-to-person transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in tourist preferences due to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased preference for private transportation over public transportation","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Perceived health risks related to covid-19 in tourism activities","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological risks related to anxiety and fear about covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourists consuming foreign or exotic foods may be blamed for disease transmission, leading to social risk.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Biased risk perceptions of covid-19, with individuals perceiving their own risk as lower than others.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in risk perceptions based on demographic characteristics, cultural background, and socio-psychological features.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourists may engage in novelty-seeking behavior, leading to increased risk of contracting contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wildlife consumption by tourists may lead to the transmission of zoonotic diseases and global health and increased risk of disease transmission within the vehicle.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological reservations affecting destination
